The first and second part of The remedy of loue. VVritten by Sir Thomas Ouerbury Knight Remedia amoris. English Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D. Overbury, Thomas, Sir, 1581-1613.
[32] p.
Printed by Nicholas Okes, and are to be sold by Iohn VVels at his shop in Fetter-lane and in the Temple, London : 1620.
A translation of: Ovid. Remedia amoris. In verse. Signatures: A-B. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Running title reads: The remedy of loue. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

A translation of: Ovid. Remedia amoris. In verse. Signatures: A-B. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Running title reads: The remedy of loue. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
